website_summaries.verdict: A good inexpensive reel that is smooth and may make you want another.
pros: Holds a lot of small diameter line
Cast and retrieve are consistent and reliable
cons: The drag can be a little slow when fighting a fish

customer_reviews.title: Very durable reel.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic reel. Anyone fishing in Alaska knows how challenging the terrain can be on gear. From gritty sandy beaches of Seward and Salty water. To glacier silty river banks of Ship creek or Bird Creek. Or big rocks of Kenai River. And a few spots that will go unmentioned. This reel has handle it all and with general maintenance and the end of each season, this reel is still in great shape. As long as they keep making this reel, I will buy it. And I have had no problems reeling in a King Salmon, Silver Salmon, or a Sockeye Salmon.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Williams

customer_reviews.title: and was able to land a 7lb small mouth on this ultralight setup after a lengthy and incredibly fun fight. The drag worked flawlessly and the casting ...
customer_reviews.text: I paired this reel with a Fenwick Eagle 6' light action 2 piece rod for creek fishing here in the Ozarks. I spooled it with 6lb Spiderwire braid with a 8lb fluorocarbon leader, and was able to land a 7lb small mouth on this ultralight setup after a lengthy and incredibly fun fight.The drag worked flawlessly and the casting and retrieval on this little guy is impressively smooth for a reel at this price point. I've ordered several reels in this size and price range, and so far this has been my favorite. If feels and functions like a $100 reel. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: turkeyfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth reel with great build quality for the price. Drag seems smooth as well. Paired it with a Daiwa ultralight travel rod and love the combo.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Mount base is far too large to fit any Freshwater rod!
customer_reviews.text: This reel was not just outrageously heavy, but the mount point was far, far to large to fit any Freshwater nor Saltwater rod I have nor can find. It appears Okuma made an error in producing this reel. It has a base which is 1/8" wider and 3/4" longer than any common bait casting, Spinning reels I can find. Perhaps it's meant for the over the top trolling rods except the drag is not sufficient for such use. Thank goodness Amazon provided a return for it. If only they had said it's base was so over the top in size before I bought it, I wouldn't have bothered.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Okuma Reel C40 and C30
customer_reviews.text: Best inexpensive reel I have purchased yet. I just returned from a week long fishing trip in Ontario. I purchased two C40s and a C30 to pair up with two Fenwick HMGs and a St Croix Premier. The reels work flawlessly and I even had control woth a 42" northern with only 6 pound test as I was fishing for large brook trout. the drag worked aweseome. I will order two more c40s.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel for Under $40
customer_reviews.text: It's a good reel for the dollar. I paid $33 and would recommend it at that price over just about anything else, but the normal price appears to be $49 which I feel is too high. I own a Pfleuger President in the size 20 model and it is smaller, lighter, and smoother. If it's under $40 then it's worth otherwise I'd rather get the Pfleuger.
customer_reviews.author: GeekFrog

customer_reviews.title: Nice little reel
customer_reviews.text: Great little reel for ice fishing, I don’t feel likes it’s as smooth as the my Pflueger president xt reels, but at one third the price it’s an awesome value. My only complaint with the reel is my own fault. There was an inch or two of water sitting on the ice, I set my rod down in the water to help land a monster and the next week or two, the live line switch was unresponsive, I ended up putting the reel on the defrost of my truck for an hour and it’s worked perfect ever since.
customer_reviews.author: KJD

customer_reviews.title: Easily handles my 27" redfish and 23" spotted sea trout
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly smooth. Easily handles my 27" redfish and 23" spotted sea trout. A very cost effective reel that works best on a 7' light action, or at most, a medium action rod if you want to have a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: DaveB

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Reel at a Incredible Price
customer_reviews.text: Paired my C-10 with a 5'6 Okuma ultralight rod and I headed to the creek to cast some 1/32 oz jigs on 4. lb test. What a slick working, easy fishing and unbelievably fun to fish outfit. From Green sunfish to Rock bass and a dozen Smallmouth all the way up to a pound and a half. Everything I caught was simply more fun on this little Ultra Light rig. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mountains are Calling

customer_reviews.title: I'd keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Overall: not impressed with this reel. It's handle isn't the best thing to try and grab in a fast response situation (I've missed it multiple times when trying to reach for it quickly), the retrieval rate is sluggish, sometimes the bail won't stay open, and it lacks the sensativity my Penn has I can get a feel for how much lure is moving through the water by the feel of reeling in. It's not bad, but I'd definitely say there's better reels out there for the money.
customer_reviews.author: KuJo

customer_reviews.title: Great reel!
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible reel.I've had zero issues with it since buying, and I have used it a lot.I mostly wade fish in creeks while using this,so it has been accidentally dunked under water many times with no problems. The drag is super smooth and I never worry about line tangling up.I use 4 to 6 pound line for Smallmouth bass,and regularly catch big Drum (attached photo) on it.The drag has never caused a line break,even when these big fish make fast runs.Highley recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Works but...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the c-10 reel about a month ago mainly for pan fish and the shad run that happens in the early spring. It is a solid little reel but after about two weeks it makes a funny sound when i am reeling in line, it still works fine might need some grease, but being that is practically new that bothers me a tad. Would i buy it again probably not, if i where to buy another reel of this size and price point i would just stick to the Pflueger 6920 after owning it for a year its still a great little piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good light reel under $50
customer_reviews.text: Nice, high quality reel. Paired it with a medium light Berkeley Cherrywood. First time out caught a nice 19” speckled trout. Good light rig for kayak fishing in the intracoastal in Florida. We’ll see how it does against a big redfish. Decent value but also take a look at the Diawa Crossfire 2000. Both catch fish but costs a little less. Also, don’t fall for the marketing hype on the number of ball bearings. You don’t need more than 3 and they all aren’t created equal.
customer_reviews.author: Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Nice little reel
customer_reviews.text: Okuma makes quality products even at this low price point. At this moment, I have fished with the reel once and it is as smooth as any of my better reels (mostly Penn). Looks sharp, has a good drag system. I can't speak to durability yet but performance is good. Balances well on my Cadence 6 1/2' light spinning rod, spooled with 6# test.
customer_reviews.author: Huntryx

customer_reviews.title: Budget Friendly
customer_reviews.text: By far the best fresh water and salt water spinning reel for your money. Extremely light and easy to cast lures all day without and fatigue in your arms and wrist. Have pulled in 10 to 15 pound red fish with the 30 and 40 models. Just takes a little more patience and work due to a less pound of drag than other inshore reels but makes it challenging and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Good value and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the 2000 version paired with a light ugly stik for fishing my local river. Been catching a lot of perch, largemouth (2-3lbs), and even some stripers! Paired it with some 6lb braid. No issues yet. I’m impressed with the quality of this reel at the price point. I’m beating this thing up daily and it still works fine. I even caught a 10+ lb carp on this thing by accident, but had to baby it in. I’d recommend this for sure, but can’t speak to long-term usage. It does seem a little flimsy sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew David Welch

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth turning reel. Drag was smooth and worked well with yellowtail, mangroves, grunts and several 25lb+ 'cudas. Used 20 lb braid. 7 foot MH graphite rod.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter

customer_reviews.title: Faulty out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: The reel I received was faulty. Super disappointed as I didn’t get to use it yet and it’s past its return date. As seen in the video, the reel at times (must be at a particular spot) can and will reel backwards. The spool does not always lock. This will be very problematic when setting the hook. I have not been able to reach customer service at this point. Needless to say I’m frustrated as I have a reel that I don’t trust at quite a substantial price point. I hope this helps, as there is a chance you may get a lemon. Any customer service help would be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be high quality
customer_reviews.text: I haven't bought a new reel in over 15 years. I looked at internet reviews and settled on this reel. When I received it I was a bit shocked - it was butter smooth in the retrieve, balanced perfectly, and built of robust materials. Either reels have improved substantially in quality over the past 15 years or this is just an awesome reel. I'm looking forward to using it in the field soon.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth browne

customer_reviews.title: Great value reel.
customer_reviews.text: I own this in two sizes the 10 and 20. I use these reels for trout fishing. The Ceymar is a lightweight, dependable reel. Never had a any problem with them. The gears are smooth when reeling in. I would highly recommend this reel for anyone on a budget. You can pair the 10 or 20 with and ultralight to light rod respectively.
customer_reviews.author: M&A

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got this on black Friday and I enjoy it for the price I got it for. The drag is very responsive and honestly impressive. It's current price is a bit much for not having a collapsible handle but those are my only gripes. It makes a perfect crappie/walleye reel. Currently, I have it on my deadstick but I could use it on anyone of my numerous poles and not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not very smooth
customer_reviews.text: This reel is okay, and it does the job, but for a reel that is generally around $50 it does not reel as smoothly as you should expect. I have lower-cost reels that are significantly smoother. That said, I have not encountered any significant issues with it. 3 stars for an okay mid-level spinning reel.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bajier

customer_reviews.title: I've purchased 4 of these so far and I am very happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: This reel is amazingly light and has a lot of back bone for its size .I've purchased 4 of these so far and I am very happy with the results, I pair them up with medium heavy GX2 ugly stik a great rod that I love fishing with .my son and I have lots of fun shore fishing with these two combinations .thank you Okuma Ceymar !! Key west life !!
customer_reviews.author: Garry  Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Ceymar reel that I've ordered. Great product for the money ($35-$50). It was featured in a fishing magazine as the best budget spinning reel and won 2nd place after a $200 reel in the comparison. Works great with 12lb line. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Super smooth reel for cast and retrieve technique.
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth reel for cast and retrieve technique. It's light but durable. Compared to Kastking Mela, this reel doesn't get noisy after hours of use. 5 lb of drag is more than enough to land hatchery planted trouts. Paired with Ultra Light rods, this reel is a joy to use. We paired ours with a Berkley Trout Dough 6'6" fiberglass rod. Looking forward to more catches next trout season.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos B. MangrobangTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Really Versatile Reel
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these, great for panfish but got enough guts to bring a bass or a walleye. I only docked 1 star because the bail is a little stubborn closing when you crank the the handle. I use these for both ice and open water. The quality is exceptional for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt A.

customer_reviews.title: Reel foot broke
customer_reviews.text: Great spinning reel until it breaks. Was kayak fishing and the reel foot broke when reeling in my spinner bait, line was a 8 lb mono and the bait was a 3/8 oz spinner and the reel foot broke as i was retrieving it, line snapped and the reel went into the lake. Waste of money....
customer_reviews.author: David Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nice, smooth and economical!
customer_reviews.text: For the price I've found this to be a great little reel... can't speak to its durability yet but it casts well, the drag is nice and smooth and everything feels pretty solid. I recently returned a reel I paid twice as much for that wasn't as good as this one.
customer_reviews.author: MrBill92124

customer_reviews.title: Great little UL option
customer_reviews.text: This has to be my favorite reel. An absolute joy to cast and pretty affordable. I'm sure some of the more expensive options are better but I think it would be hard to beat this for the money. The finish is surprisingly durable as well, survived quote a few drops with no scuffs to show for it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Okuma C-30
customer_reviews.text: Received item as described and very pleased with the product! Very smooth casting and the drag is really good on bigger fish. Highly recommend this reel at this price point for ultralight fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Webbslinger

customer_reviews.title: Quality Reel
customer_reviews.text: My first time using Okuma brand reel, and I like it so far. It looks and feels solid to the hand unlike other brands comaparable to its price. The Okuma Ceymar casts and reels in smooth as well. It's a quality reel.
customer_reviews.author: bobw

customer_reviews.title: The tolerance for the reel nut was way off. ...
customer_reviews.text: The tolerance for the reel nut was way off. Finger tight and still had a half inch of slop. The shaft snapped about 2 turns after finger tight and left me with a worthless reel. Should have bought a bait caster.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Packer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel!
customer_reviews.text: Smooth reel with comfortable padded handle. Quality feel and awesome look. I bought C10 size. It is noticable smaller than Shimano 1000 size reel. Ceymar C10 is perfect match to Okuma guide select pro rod 7'6" ultra light
customer_reviews.author: Libby Libretti

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased
customer_reviews.text: I pair this pretty reel is with a Shakespeare ugly stik GX2 medium power rod. Couldn't be any more pleased with its appearance and performance With a price tag of ~$40 dollar you won't find a better reel elsewhere. Promise.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. L

customer_reviews.title: this reel is small in size but build quality and handling are great! I bought this for me but so far ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, this reel is small in size but build quality and handling are great! I bought this for me but so far my son (7yo) has been using this primarily and he's hauled up some good-sized fish with it (including a 2.5 lb smallmouth) and it's worked great. We have it on a 7' fast-action rod and it's a great setup. I will probably pick up a C-40 and C-10 at some point. Tremendous value, I'm very happy with this reel!
customer_reviews.author: A. P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bad Reel
customer_reviews.text: The product did not last it all, I cast lots of jerkbaits all the time the jerkbaits are 5/8oz and the handle has gone loose and it come loose all the time so I check in and the handle is broken inside the handle and now is stock
customer_reviews.author: Following the striper

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Okuma makes great reels. At almost every price point. Their saltwater stuff if really tough and smooth. Can’t beat the price point on this Ceymar. It’s my second Ceymar. Haven’t seen a drawback yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel
customer_reviews.text: Great reel. Very smooth and the drag is unbelievable. I use it in saltwater just about every weekend and have no problems. Just rinse after each use and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Okuma!
customer_reviews.text: Most of my tackle budget these days goes for Okuma products. In my experience, comparable Shimano or Daiwa rods and reels go for 30% to 60% more. Okuma's customer service is unbeatable. I sent them a spinning reel that was grinding due to me having dropped it in the sand. I had it back in about 10 days, good as new, no charge! When I called to order a part, same thing, friendly service and no charge! I can't say anything bad about these guys, they take care of their customers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing item for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these for my kids. They work great, the drag is easy to set, they are extremely smooth in operation and there is no back movement in the reel when trying to set hooks. Couldn't ask for anything more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gene W.

customer_reviews.title: well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: read several reviews that rated this reel as a great value. They were right. The first time out I tangled with a very large rainbow trout. Reel performed flawlessly with 4 lb test mono. Now I have a new personal best for trout. Never used an Okuma reel before but will try more of them.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Glory Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used this regularly for the last month or so with no issues. Smooth, incredibly light, and inexpensive. Hard to argue with this if you are looking for an UL setup.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little reel
customer_reviews.text: Great reel for ice fishing, and one of the lighter options available in this size. I use pflueger, 13 Fishing, and several cheaper brands of reels on my ice rods and this is my favorite reel.
customer_reviews.author: Cody W Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: This reel has really surprised me. Incredibly smooth. Lightweight without feeling cheaply made. Compact. Smaller than many other reels labeled “UL”.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Shiflett

customer_reviews.title: Small but smooth
customer_reviews.text: Glides like a much more expensive reel. I would say the spool diameter is a lot smaller than i thought...if you are using a thicker line you may have a little bird nesting..so far its been fine with my braid.
customer_reviews.author: Hieu N.

customer_reviews.title: This reel has been used in sat water for the ...
customer_reviews.text: This reel has been used in sat water for the past two months. It’s washed with freshwater after each use. Still works buttery smooth. I will update review if any problems arise as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly/Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, smooth action reel at the best price.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro and don't spend $$ on fancy fishing gear. This reel makes me feel like I do. Smooth and super consistent. Quality feel, light but tight.
customer_reviews.author: DV8

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: I got this reel as a gift for my dad, who is an avid fisherman. He generally likes Shimano reels, but was completely surprised with the quality of Okuma reel. He got quite many pikes weighting from 1 lbs to 5 lbs with the Okuma reel, and asked me to get one more for him.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey Krasovski

customer_reviews.title: Great brook trout reel
customer_reviews.text: I used this reel for brook trout fishing this summer and loved it. The drag was very smooth and never had a "rats nests" with 4 lb test.
customer_reviews.author: Romby

customer_reviews.title: Third one!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third ceymar. Amazing value. I light line and the only negative is low drag resistance which doesn’t bother me. I don’t horse fish in, so is ideal for me. Can’t say enough good things about them!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hornung

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the smallest one for my ultralight setup. Really nice look and performance. Retrieval is smooth, but a little rougher when compared to a Pflaugher Presidential reel.
customer_reviews.author: Ranagedsl

customer_reviews.title: Best Spinning Reel I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: This reel is definitely the best spinning reel I've owned, though admittedly it was the first one I purchased after some research. It is lightweight, ergonomic, powerful and dependable. I've count countless bass, panfish, catfish, and pike with this thing, and it's still going strong. For the price it can't be beat, looks pretty cool too!
customer_reviews.author: robert volm

customer_reviews.title: "best buy" in okuma reels
customer_reviews.text: I think this reel represents the absolute best value for the money in Okuma spinning reels. I have an Epixor that does not outperform this reel.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Good reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good reel for the price. Bail is a little harder to spring than I'd like but it's some may like it. Smooth and no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet, but the gears feel smooth and the reel feels well made. I’m looking forward to slaying fish with it this weekend. I’ve used Okuma reels for salmon in past and they’ve done me well. I couldn’t see this one being any different.
customer_reviews.author: TDT

customer_reviews.title: Smooth like glass
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girl. Reel is super smooth, sometimes I steal it when she's not using it. I'm actually thinking about buying the c-40 for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great for pond or lake fishing!
customer_reviews.text: Great little reel for freshwater fishing. I tried it out in the gulf and it barley reeled in a 18” red. The handle feels a bit flimsy. It’s a good reel for the money for pond or lake fishing though. I wound up buying the okuma CJ-40s and reeled in two 25 pound barracuda with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great smooth reel. Buying more!!
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, quality reel. Purchased mainly for brown trout stream fishing, ceymar c-20, and was so impressed with smoothness and drag I took it largemouth fishing using a drop shot rig aka light line finesse. Landed countless large pickerel and bass up to 4 pounds and the reel handled with zero issues. I will definitely be purchasing More reels from Okuma. Great job guys. Ty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel
customer_reviews.text: Great reel and excellent value. Have taken it saltwater fishing 2x and find it is very smooth and have had no problems handling the fish. Seems to be very good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good reel for the price, smooth when reeling in I would have gave it 5 stars but the drag is a little stiff when fighting fish
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G Boevingloh

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reel for pan fishing or crappie fishing would also work really good for trout fishing as well. Build quality is not bad and for the price you just can't beat it. Ended up hanging into a 4 lb Channel cat and was able to bring it in with no problems. I would highly recommend this real
customer_reviews.author: supermom724

customer_reviews.title: I caught Bass using this Reel!
customer_reviews.text: Great reel! I used this about 6 times now and have been able to catch Bass between 1 to 2 lbs. I am happy with the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Huy Le

customer_reviews.title: Decent Reel
customer_reviews.text: Decent reel however once we put line on it kept trying to unwind. My son replaced with another reel weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: HamDude

customer_reviews.title: A step up from button rung reels. (C-10)
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lelands ultra light combo (the super cheap green one), but the reel it came with was stiff and not great. I bought this as a replacement and it’s a lot better. It’s smoother and casts much further. I had a little doubt when I opened the box and felt it, but on the rod it does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: MrJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This has been my favorite Okuna reel. From fishing for trout to bass and fishing for catfish awesome reel lightweight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bang for buck right here
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reel, best of the cheap. Many 3lb plus bass on 4lb test and this little beast. Fell off the float tube in water, took about 10 minutes to get it back, shook it out and NO ISSUES. Super impressed. Buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Tumbleweeds

customer_reviews.title: The reel was a little stiff right out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: The reel was a little stiff right out of the box, but the more I use it the smoother it becomes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Reams

customer_reviews.title: Great small reel
customer_reviews.text: C-10 Exactly what expected, matched with 4lbs and ultralight fenwick HMG makes great combo. Read some people were shocked/put off by small size - this is a small reel so be aware of that before you buy it. Yes, Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real reel for real big fish
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small reel for big fish. This little reel holds enough line and is strong enough for the big redfish I catch. I catch them with finess baits on light line on ultralight rods. This reel is just as tough as the larger models and the drag is good. For the money it’s the best 1000 size reel I ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Phishyy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've been using two of these for a few months now for anything from panfish to walleye to bass to pike, they perform well and I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: CJ M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Father's Day gift for my father. This reel is by far one of the best reels on the market for the money. My father can't stop talking about how much he loves the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Handle came off
customer_reviews.text: Defective handle. I've only had this reel for less than a month. The handle, the part that turns freely, came off during my surf fishing this morning. I didn't realize that it had come off until I had a bite, picked up my fishing rod from my rod holder, and realized that the handle was missing. Lost the handle and lost the fish.
customer_reviews.author: Tawnee Vallar

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth action! Zero backlash at the handle. Smooth and predictable drag!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Budget at best
customer_reviews.text: The old saying stands true. You get what you paid for. Really cheap
customer_reviews.author: Scott Giamichael

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a trip to the Nipigon. Spooled it with spiderwire braid on a Fenwick HMG. Performed beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: JJC

customer_reviews.title: Very Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Quick retrieval of the lures. Quite operating. And so far holding up against some large Florida bass.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought the C-30 and the C-40 and am really pleased with both
customer_reviews.text: These reels are the real deal. Light weight, smooth, strong. I bought the C-30 and the C-40 and am really pleased with both. Have caught numerous stripers and spanish mackerel with the 40 and it took it all without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Derek B.

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: Smooth action, well made, GREAT price. I own two and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and smooth
customer_reviews.text: Tried the 20 size. Very decent reel for sure. Found no issue. Spins very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Walden

customer_reviews.title: Good reel for price
customer_reviews.text: Good looking reel and nice weight match with my st. croix panfish rod. The reel could be a little smoother on the retrieve, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: ynoTTodd

customer_reviews.title: Great Ultralight reel
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Smooth operation. True Ultralight feel.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin  L. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Keeper for sure
customer_reviews.text: One of the new reels in my set. In the $50 dollar price range this was the one to beat out of the 6 or so I ordered to check out. Tried: AV-30b Sougailang Unamed - No drag specs Penn Pursuit Kastking Centurion This and the Pursuit were my keepers. Smooth, bearings solid, good companies (subjective obviously), drag right, feels great, great for my kids and overall quality fit me well
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reel!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reel super smooth.. Best reel i have gotten in this price range by far. Bought a second one..
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: price point. Value
customer_reviews.text: good reel for the money spent. Very smooth for this pricepoint.
customer_reviews.author: rtreefanatic

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and Very Light!
customer_reviews.text: I did not think it possible but this reel replaces my 1980 Orvis 50A on my Fenwick 4.5' UL rod!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas E. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: great ice fishing reel
customer_reviews.text: very affordable in a size that sure to fit all your fishing needs
customer_reviews.author: Angie Leisy

customer_reviews.title: Great setup for ultralight.
customer_reviews.text: Reel was smaller then I thought but that is fine, using this as my ultralight setup!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Colin W.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Great price
customer_reviews.text: This has been an awsome little reel. I use it for trout fishing and have caught plenty of big browns and rainbows. Even accidentally submerged it underwater and it's still as smooth as the day I got it. Great value for the money...the only thing I don't care for is that the knobs are circle. I'm getting use to them though.
customer_reviews.author: David Ohlert

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: Great reels. Sturdy, smooth, and affordable. Nice bearing count, sturdy reel body with little or no flex. Available in sizes for pan fish all the way to salt water monsters.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best value small size reel. Used on an ice rod. Impressively built for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: Reid M

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It is super smooth and comfortable and has a great drag
customer_reviews.author: J A C

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Fantastic reel.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ultralight purchase. Been fishing on it for 9 months. Love this reel. Very smooth long casts with quick return. Absolutely no complaints about it. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy P McMullen

customer_reviews.title: Reel handle broke in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this reel less than 3 weeks ago and somehow the metal part inside the handle has already been bent? I’m not even sure how this happens...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: A little bit heavy but otherwise a great reel. Spins effortlessly, smooth bail, feels like it is a really high quality build.
customer_reviews.author: Dave1424

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the C-10's for over a year now and they are my go to panfish reel for my ice fishing rigs. I know some folks like to change out the washer for a the carbon one but I have never had a problem. At $33.75 this reel is a steal. I don't even have a rod for it but I now I have a reason to do a little more shopping
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Value plus
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reel great quality for the money very happy with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Mtn man

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This reel made a loud squeaking sound right out of the box. I lubricated it and the sound continued and then it started making a grinding sound. Definitely not what I was expecting since I own an identical reel and have used it heavily. I am disappointed by this lack of reliability and quality control from Okuma.
customer_reviews.author: Real Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Great crappie reel
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth and can cast it a mile !!! even with a light weight jig head. Smooth retrieval, Quiet and easy adjusting drag. Have caught some large fish with (3-6 LB) it no problem with 4 LB test line. NICE REEL
customer_reviews.author: Judy Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Cast far smooth reel
customer_reviews.text: So far this reel is nice. Very smooth cast great. I've used it two times on Rivers catching smallies. Good reel
customer_reviews.author: Hoytbronco

customer_reviews.title: My older son has now had two of these and ...
customer_reviews.text: My older son has now had two of these and both seem to have a problem with the retrieve. Something is out of balance and sending back. Will try something else, maybe a Shimano.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Fish

product_meta.title: Okuma Ceymar Spinning Reel
feature_bullets: Made using the highest quality materials

LIGHTWEIGHT COMFORT – Designed with comfort in mind. The soft touch and feel of the light weight, EVA handles knobs, combined with the graphite body construction, bring you a reel that is light and strong starting out at just 6 ounces in weight
